docs.title: Welcome
docs.text: The intention for this site is to document some of my personal projects in coding as well as music and songwriting. You will find a range from coding tutorials to personal lyrics and recordings.

docs.title: Coding Home
docs.text: This section of the Mondomonorepo houses various code hacks and utilities that I've used over the years. Some pages are tutorials for existing tools, some are custom applications.

docs.title: COVID-19 Custom Reporting
docs.text: During the onset of COVID, I wrote some SAS programs to generate reports of COVID levels for areas of my own personal interest. However, the program is customizable to any locale. While hopeful that I will not need to utilize this tool again, pieces may be useful for future projects. The latest version can be found in my GitHub Repository.

docs.title: Using Material for MkDocs with GitHub Pages
docs.text: This page includes step-by-step instructions as well as helpful tips for utilizing Material for MkDocs to serve your GitHub documentation (it is what the Mondomonorepo is running on right now).

docs.title: GitHub Pages
docs.text:
To get your GitHub Pages site up and running, follow the steps documented by GitHub.

The best Material for MkDocs resource currently available is hosted at squidfunk.github.io. There are a ton of examples on different styling and extensions to use with mkdocs.

docs.title: Spinning up Locally
docs.text: For spinning up locally, you'll be using a Virtual Environment (venv). You'll need to have Python 3.7 or later installed as well as Visual Studio Code.

docs.title: Initial Setup
docs.text:
1. Clone your repository.

  2. From your repository root, create and activate your venv using the following commands. 

      python -m venv .\venv
  .\venv\Scripts\activate.bat

    Note

    if Python is not found, you may need to add it to your PATH

  3. Next you'll install requirements using the following command. 

      pip install -r requirements.txt

    Note

    Here is a list of the dependencies used in this repository. (1)

    1. attrs beautifulsoup4 bleach certifi cffi charset-normalizer click colorama cryptography defusedxml entrypoints fastjsonschema ghp-import gitdb GitPython idna importlib-metadata Jinja2 jsonschema jupyter-client jupyter-core jupyterlab-pygments Markdown MarkupSafe mergedeep mistune mkdocs mkdocs-autolinks-plugin mkdocs-awesome-pages-plugin mkdocs-glightbox mkdocs-material mkdocs-material-extensions mkdocs-monorepo-plugin mkdocs-open-in-new-tab mknotebooks nbclient nbconvert nbformat nest-asyncio packaging pandocfilters pycparser pygments PyJWT pymdown-extensions pyparsing pyrsistent python-dateutil python-slugify pywin32; sys_platform == "win32" PyYAML pyyaml-env-tag pyzmq requests six smmap soupsieve text-unidecode tinycss2 tornado traitlets urllib3 watchdog webencodings zipp

  4. Serve locally using the following command. 

      mkdocs serve

    Note

    Mkdocs serve will serve your site at: http://127.0.0.1:8000/ and will listen for changes as you develop in your IDE.

docs.title: Going Forward
docs.text:
After you've run the intial setup steps above (cloning your repo, creating your venv, installing requirements) it's fairly simple to serve your project locally. You'll just need to follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to your repo directory
  2. Activate your venv (.\venv\Scripts\activate.bat)
  3. Serve! (mkdocs serve)

docs.title: Songwriting Home
docs.text:
This section of the Mondomonorepo houses various assets related to songwriting and music projects - either solo projects of my own or material from my band New Sweat.

The Projects page has a list of links and resources for my various music projects - streaming services, social media, etc.

The Lyrics section contains all original lyrics. Some have associated music, some are still waiting for their chance to be paired.

Your browser does not support the audio element.

We’ve been running around this town for awhile now, At times I think I forgot how it feels, To be humming tunes for you in my free time, But forgotten isn't gone, And I think I wanna kick those wheels. Life’s been coming at us at a breakneck speed, Barely lets us dust off our clothes, It’s been a fine forest full of bittersweet, Think it’s time we harvest ourselves a sweet old grove. I see a rolling countryside shining in my mind, Sweet breeze pushing right past your hair, A foggy cup of coffee is by your side, We could go get lost, if we could just get there. If all I leave behind is these old love songs, I think I’m pretty okay with that, Our story has unraveled across these six strings, One day our grandkids just might play it back.

Copyright © 2023 Abram Kline

Eleven years of you and me, living in married bliss, Sure 10 gets all the sun with its fanfare and fun, But with 10+1 there’s something that people miss, The steadfast dedication in the shadow of an epic vacation isn’t easy for sure, Showing up every day, in a lovingly way, Knowing full well there’ll be no Italian shore, It’s easy when waking to breathtaking landscaping of gently rolling hills, And much harder it seems living suburbian dreams, Surviving on memories and stills, Eleven is there with its grace and its care, aware it'll be bare an extravagant trip, But it’s here nonetheless, it doesn’t need any press, Proving that true love isn’t a blip, Adventure-seeking or not, it honestly doesn’t matter one bit, Whether darling or din, whatever world that I’m in, It’s always the best when you’re in it.

Copyright © 2024 Abram Kline

What's is all for? Spinning our wheels, Chasing down some shadow, Of what we thought was real. Take a step back, Assess what's at the core, Trim off all the fat, You'll end up with more.

Let it all go, The shape of what you know, Crumbles to the floor, When you release your ego, Time it flies by, And the memories fade away, But the ones that made your mold, Feels just like yesterday.

When it boils down, The greatest moments in life, Are sights and sounds, I can see it know, Emotion rushes in and my heart pounds, It's pretty profound, That an image in my mind can heal me when I'm feeling down, I've finally come around, To letting go and holding on to all the moments I just can't live without.

Time is only ours, If we take it and run at the stars, It's a single shot, and I'm not missing out on this one.

Copyright © 2022 Abram Kline

docs.title: All I Can Say
docs.text:
Well I don’t know, Where this life might take me, But I can hope, It takes me somewhere beautiful.

I always ask why, Things are the way they are, But I’ve got to rely, That it’s been written in the stars.

All I can say is make way, Cause I’ve got plans today, And I’m gonna get em done.

Well I can’t see what this life might hold for me, But I’ll try to be the best man I can be.

Copyright © 2005 Abram Kline

docs.title: Around the World
docs.text:
The night it creeps, It sneaks up on us like a thief, Next thing we’re asleep. Sunrise it screams, It wakes us from a sound sleep, We find our feet.

But we’re no slaves to this life, We can do with it what we like, We can grasp each moment before it goes, And if we don’t we’ll never know.

I’ve been around the world ten times in my mind, I’ve seen the seven oceans shine, I’ve climbed the peaks in Nepal and Japan, I’ve walked across the desert sands.

This life it seems, We get so caught up planning everything, That we lose our dreams, This life we live, It begs for us to take in all it gives, There’s so many gifts.

But we’re no slaves to this life, We can do with it what we like, We can grasp each moment before it goes, And if we don’t we’ll never know.

I’ll be around the world ten times before I die, I’ll see the seven the oceans shine and they’ll shine so bright, And you can bet on my life that when I die, You’ll bury me with a smile. I’ll be around the world ten times. You’ll bury me with a smile.

Copyright © 2011 Abram Kline

docs.title: Candle
docs.text:
Life gets so fast sometimes, it's a little hard to handle, But I've been so blessed, that nothing else could light a candle to what I've got, It's why I'm here today, It's why I came to say, "I Do",

Though life may be hard sometimes, I know that, with you by my side, We'll make it through the darkest nights, We'll always see it through,

Because baby you're my candle in the dark, You give me strength to handle the weight of the world, Together we will wrangle in the stars, To light up our whole life when times are hard.

Our family's all in town, And our friends have gathered round to celebrate, You're beautiful in white on a beautiful night, What more could I say?

Though life may be hard sometimes, I know that, with you by my side, We'll make it through the darkest nights, We'll always see it through,

Because baby you're my candle in the dark, You give me strength to handle the weight of the world, Together we will wrangle in the stars, To light up our whole life when times are hard.

Because baby you're my candle in the dark, You give me strength to handle the weight of the world, Together we will wrangle in the stars, To light up our whole life when times are hard.

And when it's time for the last call, You know I'm down for the long haul home with you.

Copyright © 2013 Abram Kline

docs.title: Cold Season
docs.text:
The cold winds blowing in, Autumn leaves are falling, Long sleeves they’re calling, To warm our skin. The night air smells of burning, The furnace is fired up, The houses they’re all shut, To keep the warm in.

Dylan's in the blankets, And Hooch is at our feet, The house breathes deep, The kids, they’re fast asleep. Pumpkins lit with candles, And children draped in sheets, It’s your favorite season, And you’re my favorite treat.

The cold season blows in, But it’s alright by me, Cause I found another reason, To pull you in close to me, We’ll curl up by the fire, And sip wine by candle light, I found another reason, Why the cold season, it’s all right.

October, November, December, Each day that goes by and the more I remember, You’re the reason for my seasons, And no matter the weather, you’ll always make it better.

Copyright © 2011 Abram Kline

docs.title: Enough
docs.text:
Your heart’s so big it pulled me in, You’ve got so much love, where do I begin? Every morning, you say “Good morning, sunshine.” Puts a smile on my face every time.

Cause we’ve got it so good, Like all true lovers should, We don’t have to worry about much, Cause we’ve got each other, And that’s enough.

You’re my number one fan, supporting the band, You come to every single show you can, You’re making me pancakes after those late nights when my lazy head is sleeping in, Drinking some coffee over a crossword, It’s the simple things that make me breathe, I plan on making this a habit for further out that I can see.

Sure we’ll argue from time to time, So I’ve heard, true love doesn’t walk a straight line, Yea we’ll have our ups and downs, But I hope you find comfort in knowing that I’m always gonna be around.

Copyright © 2011 Abram Kline

docs.title: Hypnotized
docs.text:
Fire-filled skies fade fast behind me as I plunge into the night, And I know these flames will find my eyes again once I reach the other side, Dimly lit orbs fly past in pairs to my left, Embers lag behind and chase a dying sunset. Black sheets roll beneath my feet and spinning steel, Hurling me home where the passion is real.

Pedal to the floor and you know I’m on my way, An early twilight arrival, true love at day break, I fall into my niche, I drown in brown eyes, Never again a need to use our goodbyes.

Somehow an angel has fallen in this bed, Finagled her halo from off of her head, She lays by my side with her eyes open wide, There’s a gate in the sky god left open wide. There’s fire in the skies, There’s fire in my mind, There’s fire in the night, The fire in your eyes has got me hypnotized.

Copyright © 2010 Abram Kline

docs.title: Left Lane
docs.text:
Some say that distance makes the heart grow fonder, As long as you don’t let your mind get lost and wander. Well, I guess that I might be the case, But I’d still rather be sitting here staring at your pretty face.

We’ve got a lot of highway lying in between us, Ain’t no reason to let it get in our way, No distance could erase our fate, I’ll be wearing down a path driving northbound in the left hand lane.

We should take our time take it slow, But I really want you to know, You’re the only woman on my mind and I think you’re gonna find I’ll be driving up the road. I don’t want to lose you, And I think we’re onto something here, These Carolina skies are crying, And girl I wish you were here.

Now it seems to be we’re prisoners to proximity, Bound by these chains of a city and a street name, But I plan on busting out and breaking free, I’ll be riding 95 in the left lane, there’s a pretty lady that I’ve gotta see.

I think it’s pretty plain to see, I’ve been thinking about you constantly, Can’t hardly wait to see you, And it’ll be another couple weeks, I’ll be driving north and you’ll be coming south, You know where we’ll meet, For dinner and a sunrise, In the skies over DC.

Copyright © 2009 Abram Kline

docs.title: Lullaby
docs.text:
Well I wrote this song for you, To help you make it through the night, To drift off into your mind, When I can’t be by your side, Holding you tight, All through the night, I hope this keeps you company.

This is your lullaby.

If I was there I’d be your blanket, I’d thank the sweet lord for answering my prayers, And giving me a woman like you, To hold in my arms and give my love to, And that’s just what you do.

This is your lullaby.

Well it’s cold when you’re all alone, It don’t matter the temperature, I’ll chase away those chills, I’ll be your comforter.

So close your eyes, I hope you find peace up in your mind, Let the music pull you in, Let my words be your medicine, And drift away until the sun brings in another day.

This is your lullaby.

Copyright © 2009 Abram Kline

docs.title: November 12
docs.text:
It was a warm autumn afternoon, She didn’t have the slightest clue of what I would soon do to make it all true. I caught her by surprise, The tears from her eyes streamed down her cheeks; she could hardly speak.

I used to think it was funny how a ring could stand for everything, How a little sparkle, a little gleam, could ever change anything. I thought it was about money, exploiting love in the name of greed, But the look on her face explained everything.

Our big day will come, God willing with sun, to shine from the clouds as we say our vows. We’ll dance our first dance and start a life of romance, With just one phrase that we’ll take to our graves.

My hands they were shaking, But the chance was worth taking, Cause I knew I’d found the one, With a heart made of gold, I know we’ll grow old, And ride off into the sun, A circle and a stone, A sign you’ll never be alone, As long as I’m alive, I’ll be by your side.

Copyright © 2012 Abram Kline

docs.title: Philosophy of the Night
docs.text:
Philosophical pondering Who are we, why are we here? Where is here and what are we? Why do we doubt and praise and fear? Are we in the simulation? Is this a fabricated view? And do I really give a shit, What frame I’m looking through? If I care then why? So I can commandeer my fate? So I can feel some bit of power? So reality and I can have a date? It’s an interesting time, Taking a walk around your mind, The folds and bends inside your head, They wind and turn you back in time, And to the future whatever that means, When time is but a memory, It’s warped and maybe spiraling, Behind, ahead, just out of reach, Suppress these thoughts, Succumb to being in the dark, Blissfully unaware or not, It’s all just dogs without a bark, We can grasp onto some belief, And hold it fiercely in the deep, Then it is real, we made it be, Even if there is no we, Even if there is no proof, No evidential smoking gun, I know these thoughts are real, I know I’m thinking and it’s fun, Now two things are true for me, At a very bare minimum, I’m sure there are more to see, Somewhere inside of my cerebrum.

Copyright © 2024 Abram Kline

docs.title: Queen Bee
docs.text:
Music is my mistress and that’s how it’ll always be, But you’ll never find me cheating or lacking loyalty, Cause I’ll always love you woman, And I’ll always treat you kind, But music is my mistress, Cause she’s always on my mind.

I’ll be humming in the morning, And strumming every chance I get, I’ll write lots of love songs about you, So many that you’ll never forget, Just how much I love you and how much you mean to me, See music is my mistress, But you’ll always be my queen bee.

There will never come a day that I’ll ever say, “I don’t want to play.” Cause there’s something in my soul that makes me feel whole every time I unlock that case, The way you make me feel makes it all real when I put a pencil to a page, You bring the music out of me and you’re so honey sweet, and you’ll always be my queen bee.

Music is my mistress but she’s not your enemy, She’s kind and warm, and true to form, And always good company, She’ll keep me out late from time to time, But she’ll never cross the line, Music is my mistress, but you’ll always be queen of the hive.

Copyright © 2011 Abram Kline

docs.text:

docs.title: New Sweat Links
docs.text:

  • Spotify

docs.title: Unlock Another Door
docs.text:
Some days it seems like everywhere you turn another devil’s trying to bring you down, And the towers you’ve been building to the heavens have fallen down, But I’ve heard that when life slams another door in your face, It also plants a key in your pocket that unlocks another one someplace.

So let them tear your towers down, They don’t define you anyway. You’ll find peace in the sound. Unlock another door today.

My life’s no game day cliché pitting me against my rival, no. It’s about find purpose in my plan, beyond survival. But if you just take a second and step back, the big picture’s so clear, It’s amazing how taking perspective can melt away all your fears.

You’ve got to keep your eyes wide open, And realize that sometimes defeat is only opportunity in disguise.

Copyright © 2011 Abram Kline

docs.title: Warrenville Road
docs.text:
It was a rainy summer night on Warrenville Road, Driving in from Long Island when we lost control, We spent a couple hours with the Greenbrook Police Patrol, That silver beauty hit a pole, god rest her soul.

It could’ve been a lot worse, god forbid somebody died, When you get thrown off in this life, you’ve got to get back on and ride, The show must go on; we’ll keep on down the line, You can’t derail this train; we’ll ride right through the night.

It’s summer nights like these that make you lose your mind, You can’t quite figure out how you made it out alive, But we’ll pull it together; you know we’ll be just fine, It’s summer nights like these I thank god I’m alive.

We’ve been all the way to Florida and right back up the east coast, Seen a lot of highway; a bit more than most, To this summer I say, “Raise a glass”, and make a toast, Cause we’ve been living life and, man, the lord knows.

Copyright © 2007 Abram Kline

docs.title: Welcome Home
docs.text:
Bullet shells and beer cans on the floor of your trembling hooch, Fear and desperation, sweat and heat, hinges coming loose, A lock on your refrigerator, social norms of no more use, Army green chuck taylors, best intentions in these shoes.

A hustle in the jungle, why not try to make a buck? Nickel to drown your sorrows while you’re down here on your luck, Letters from your father, more depth than you knew was there, Perhaps he'd pushed you far enough, to finally show you that he cared.

We found the bottom of that rye and lightning took its place, Memories came pouring out, seldom shown to the light of day, Wisdom from that armchair, I'm just glad that I was there, Regrets, redemption, lessons learned, a perspective unimpaired.

Saturation for the duration, the whole damn thing right up in smoke, Touchdown garden state, wasted, in the trash, not a single welcome home, Stumbled upon an open ear in an unlikely candidate, He was too soon taken, self-inflicted, Boston held his fate.

Took a trip out west to see your brother in Idaho, Unsaid recollections reserved for only those who truly know, I can only imagine this true for all the sights you'd seen, You travel light, but always pay the baggage fee.

Some things die too hard and sometimes not at all, Some memories go too fast, some never see the curtain fall, Some are minuscule in scope, some are stories tall, Relay your lessons to those you love before the sirens start to call.

docs.title: Where You've Been
docs.text:
Life is full of lessons, You better count your blessings twice, Because you’ve only got one life, Life is like a highway, Cutting through the heartland, You can chase that horizon, but when it comes there’ll only be another one.

I don’t pretend to know what’s next, But I live my life with no regrets, Every time I trip and fall I find out who I am, It’s not knowing where you’re going, But where you’ve been.

Everyone wants to know the secret to finding happiness in their lives, Well, you don’t need to crack a safe for you to realize, It was with you all along, You had it this whole time, Don’t you know man, it’s what you’ve got inside.

I don’t pretend to know what’s next, But I live my life with no regrets. Every stone along the road has made me who I am, It’s not knowing where you’re going, But where you’ve been.

I don’t pretend to know what’s next, But I live my life with no regrets, Every time I hit a wall I’m less a child and more a man, It’s not know where you’re going, But where you’ve been.

Copyright © 2011 Abram Kline
